Returns: If the item is a heading.
isHeading().Description: Use @B_android#view#accessibility#AccessibilityNodeInfo#isHeading_E@ Gets if the collection item is a heading. For example, section heading, table header, etc.
isHeading().history: Added in API level 19 Deprecated in API level 28

getRowIndex().Description: Gets the row index at which the item is located.

getColumnIndex().Description: Gets the column index at which the item is located.

isSelected().Description: Gets if the collection item is selected.

ClassDesc: Class with information if a node is a collection item. Use @B_android#view#accessibility#AccessibilityNodeInfo#CollectionItemInfo#obtain_E@ to get an instance. Recycling is handled by the @B_android#view#accessibility#AccessibilityNodeInfo_E@ to which this object is attached. A collection item is contained in a collection, it starts at a given row and column in the collection, and spans one or more rows and columns. For example, a header of two related table columns starts at the first row and the first column, spans one row and two columns.
